title: Urban Waste Collection and Recycling Drop-Off Routing
content:
A municipal waste management fleet must collect trash (linehaul) from residential areas and deliver recyclables (backhaul) to processing centers. Trucks start at the depot (<loc_depot>) with capacity <capacity>, visiting <num_customer> locations (<loc_customer>). Each residential stop has trash demand (<demand_linehaul>), while recycling centers require pickups (<demand_backhaul>). Routes must:  
✓ Complete all trash collections before recyclable pickups (B).  
✓ Finish within driver shift limits (<time_limit> hours) (L).  
✓ Adhere to time windows for noise-sensitive zones (<time_windows>) (TW).  
✓ Allow trucks to end routes at recycling centers (O).

title: Same-Day Retail Logistics with Returns Handling
content:
An e-commerce provider uses vans to deliver online orders (<demand_linehaul>) and collect returns (<demand_backhaul>) from <num_customer> stores (<loc_customer>). Vans (<capacity>) depart from a hub (<loc_depot>). Constraints:  
✓ Deliveries must precede returns (B).  
✓ Routes cannot exceed <distance_limit> km due to perishable goods (L).  
✓ Stores accept returns only during business hours (<time_windows>) (TW).  
✓ Drivers log off at their final stop (O).

title: Medical Lab Specimen Courier Network
content:
A diagnostic lab dispatches temperature-controlled vehicles (<capacity>) from <loc_depot> to:  
1. Deliver empty specimen containers to clinics (<demand_linehaul>).  
2. Collect filled samples (<demand_backhaul>) from <num_customer> sites (<loc_customer>). Critical constraints:  
✓ Samples expire after <time_limit> hours (L).  
✓ Clinics have strict drop-off/pickup windows (<time_windows>) (TW).  
✓ Deliveries must finish before pickups (B).  
✓ Vehicles may park at final clinic overnight (O).

title: Construction Material Delivery and Debris Removal
content:

title: Festival Catering and Waste Recovery
content:
During a multi-venue festival, food trucks (<capacity>) distribute meals (<demand_linehaul>) and collect compost waste (<demand_backhaul>) from <num_customer> stages (<loc_customer>). Challenges:

title: Pharmaceutical Cold Chain Distribution with Expired Medication Collection
content: A pharmaceutical company distributes temperature-sensitive vaccines (<demand_linehaul>) to clinics (<loc_customer>) from a central depot (<loc_depot>) using refrigerated trucks (<capacity>). Clinics also return expired medications (<demand_backhaul>) that must be collected after deliveries. Each clinic has strict receiving hours (<time_windows>), and trucks must complete routes within <time_limit> hours to maintain product integrity. Routes terminate at the last clinic to avoid unnecessary refrigeration costs.

title: Floating Market Vendor Supply Chain with Empty Container Recovery
content: Boats (<capacity>) distribute fresh produce from a riverside depot (<loc_depot>) to floating market stalls (linehaul) before 6 AM (<time_windows>), then collect empty crates (backhaul). title: Disaster Relief Tent Deployment with Contaminated Shelter Retrieval
content:
Post-earthquake, trucks (<capacity>) deliver emergency tents from a base (<loc_depot>) to campsites (linehaul) within 4-hour windows (<time_windows>) and later retrieve flood-damaged tents (backhaul). Routes are capped at <duration_limit> due to driver fatigue. Trucks remain at final camps to assist with setup without returning.
```  

Each scenario explicitly incorporates:  
- **Capacity (C)** through vehicle load limits  
- **Open Routes (O)** by ending at final customer locations  
- **Backhauls (B)** with sequential delivery-pickup requirements  
- **Duration Limits (L)** for route viability  
- **Time Windows (TW)** for service constraints  

The descriptions avoid mixed backhaul constraints while maintaining realistic sector diversity (healthcare, hospitality, entertainment, traditional commerce, and emergency response).

title: Mobile Blood Donation Unit Routing with Sample Returns
content:
A blood bank operates mobile donation units that visit corporate campuses (<loc_customer>) from a central hub (<loc_depot>). Each unit has:  
- Capacity (C): <capacity> liters of blood collection/storage  
- Backhauls (B): Deliver empty collection kits (linehaul) and return with filled blood bags (backhaul)  
- Duration Limits (L): <time_limit> hours per shift due to blood spoilage risks  
- Time Windows (TW): Corporate sites only allow visits during lunch hours (<time_windows>)  
The open route (O) lets units end at final locations for overnight parking. Optimize routes to maximize collections while meeting all biological and logistical constraints.
```  
